org.presentation.cssredundancychecker.cssboxHelper

Class DOMAnalyzerEnhanced

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.presentation.cssredundancychecker.cssboxHelper.DOMAnalyzerEnhanced

  • public class DOMAnalyzerEnhanced
extends Object
    This class implements methods for the DOM tree style analysis.
    Author:
    burgetr

    • Constructor Detail

      • DOMAnalyzerEnhanced

        public DOMAnalyzerEnhanced(Document doc)
        Creates a new DOM analyzer.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document to be analyzed

      • DOMAnalyzerEnhanced

        public DOMAnalyzerEnhanced(Document doc,
                           URL baseUrl)
        Creates a new DOM analyzer.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document to be analyzed
        baseUrl - the base URL for loading the style sheets. This URL may be redefined by the <base> tag used in the document header.

      • DOMAnalyzerEnhanced

        public DOMAnalyzerEnhanced(Document doc,
                           URL baseUrl,
                           boolean detectBase)
        Creates a new DOM analyzer.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document to be analyzed
        baseUrl - the base URL for loading the style sheets. If detectBase, this URL may be redefined by the <base> tag used in the document header.
        detectBase - sets whether to try to accept the <base> tags in the document header.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultEncoding

        public String getDefaultEncoding()
        Obtains the default character encoding used for parsing the style sheets. This encoding is used when there is no other encoding specified inside the style sheet using the @charset rule. When there is no default encoding specified, this method returns null and the system default encoding is used for style sheets.
        Returns:
        The encoding name or null when there is no default encoding specified.

      • setDefaultEncoding

        public void setDefaultEncoding(String encoding)
        Sets the default character encoding used for parsing the referenced style sheets. This encoding is used when there is no other encoding specified inside the style sheet using the @charset rule.
        Parameters:
        encoding - The encoding string or null for using the system default encoding.

      • getMedia

        public String getMedia()
        Returns the type of the current medium used.
        Returns:
        the media type according to CSS

      • setMedia

        public void setMedia(String media)
        Set the type of the medium used for computing the style. Default is "screen".
        Parameters:
        media - the medium to set

      • getMediaSpec

        public cz.vutbr.web.css.MediaSpec getMediaSpec()
        Returns the full specification of the currently used medium.
        Returns:
        the media specification according to CSS

      • setMediaSpec

        public void setMediaSpec(cz.vutbr.web.css.MediaSpec media)
        Set the specification of the medium used for computing the style. The default is "screen" with some standard features that correspond to a normal desktop station.
        Parameters:
        media - the medium to set

      • getRoot

        public Element getRoot()
        Returns the root element of the document.
        Returns:
        a Element object.

      • getHead

        public Element getHead()
        Returns the <head> element.
        Returns:
        a Element object.

      • getBody

        public Element getBody()
        Returns the <body> element.
        Returns:
        a Element object.

      • getDocumentBase

        public String getDocumentBase()
        Finds the explicitly specified base URL in the document according to the HTML specification
        Returns:
        the base URL string, when present in the document or null when not present
        See Also:
        the BASE element definition

      • getCharacterEncoding

        public String getCharacterEncoding()
        Finds the explicitly specified character encoding using the <meta> tag according to the HTML specifiaction.
        Returns:
        the encoding name when present in the document or null if not present.

      • printTagTree

        public void printTagTree(PrintStream out)
        Formats the tag tree to an output stream. This is used mainly for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        out - a PrintStream object.

      • stylesToDom

        public void stylesToDom()
        Encodes the efficient style of all the elements to their style attributes. Inheritance is not applied. This is currently not necessary for the rendering. It is practical mainly together with the printTagTree method for debugging the resulting style.

      • stylesToDomInherited

        public void stylesToDomInherited()
        Encodes the efficient style of all the elements to their style attributes while applying the inheritance. This is currently not necessary for the rendering. It is practical mainly together with the printTagTree method for debugging the resulting style.

      • attributesToStyles

        public void attributesToStyles()
        Converts the HTML presentation attributes in the document body to inline styles.

      • localizeStyles

        public void localizeStyles()
        Removes all the external style sheet links and puts the whole style sheet locally to the document head.

      • getStyleSheets

        public void getStyleSheets(String media)
        Returns a vector of CSSStyleSheet objects referenced from the document for the specified media type with default values of the remaining media features. The internal style sheets are read from the document directly, the external ones are downloaded and parsed automatically.
        Parameters:
        media - the media type string

      • getStyleSheets

        public void getStyleSheets(cz.vutbr.web.css.MediaSpec media)
        Returns a vector of CSSStyleSheet objects referenced from the document for the specified media type and features. The internal style sheets are read from the document directly, the external ones are downloaded and parsed automatically.
        Parameters:
        media - the media specification

      • getStyleSheets

        public void getStyleSheets()
        Returns a vector of CSSStyleSheet objects referenced from the document for the media type set by setMedia() (or "screen" by default). The internal style sheets are read from the document directly, the external ones are downloaded and parsed automatically.

      • loadStyleSheet

        public void loadStyleSheet(URL base,
                           String href,
                           String encoding)
        Loads a stylesheet from an URL as na author style sheet. Imports all the imported style sheets before storing it.
        Parameters:
        base - the document base url
        href - the href specification
        encoding - the default encoding

      • loadStyleSheet

        public void loadStyleSheet(URL base,
                           String href,
                           String encoding,
                           DOMAnalyzerEnhanced.Origin origin)
        Loads a stylesheet from an URL and specifies the origin. Imports all the imported style sheets before storing it.
        Parameters:
        base - the document base url
        href - the href specification
        encoding - the default character encoding for the style sheet (use null for default system encoding)
        origin - the style sheet origin (author, user agent or user)

      • addStyleSheet

        public void addStyleSheet(URL base,
                          String cssdata)
        Deprecated. This method does not specify the style sheet origin; use addStyleSheet(URL, String, Origin) instead.
        Parses and adds an author style sheet represented as a string to the end of the used stylesheet lists. It imports all the imported style sheets before storing it.
        Parameters:
        base - the document base URL
        cssdata - the style string

      • addStyleSheet

        public void addStyleSheet(URL base,
                          String cssdata,
                          DOMAnalyzerEnhanced.Origin origin)
        Parses and adds an author style sheet represented as a string to the end of the used stylesheet lists. It imports all the imported style sheets before storing it. The origin of the style sheet is set to the author, agent or user. The origin influences the rule priority according to the CSS specification.
        Parameters:
        base - the document base URL
        cssdata - the style string
        origin - the style sheet origin (AUTHOR, AGENT or USER)

      • recomputeStyles

        public void recomputeStyles()
        Forces recomputing the element styles. This method should be called when a new style sheet has been added or a DOM has changed after some styles have been read from the analyzer.

      • getElementStyle

        public cz.vutbr.web.css.NodeData getElementStyle(Element el)
        Gets all the style declarations for a particular element and computes the resulting element style.
        Parameters:
        el - the element for which the style should be computed
        Returns:
        the resulting declaration

      • getElementStyleInherited

        public cz.vutbr.web.css.NodeData getElementStyleInherited(Element el)
        Gets all the style declarations for a particular element and computes the resulting element style including the inheritance from the parent.
        Parameters:
        el - the element for which the style should be computed
        Returns:
        the resulting style declaration

      • getElementStyleInherited

        public cz.vutbr.web.css.NodeData getElementStyleInherited(Element el,
                                                          cz.vutbr.web.css.Selector.PseudoDeclaration pseudo)
        Gets all the style declarations for a particular element and a particular pseudo-element and computes the resulting pseudo-element style including the inheritance from the parent.
        Parameters:
        el - the element for which the style should be computed
        pseudo - the pseudo class or element used for style computation
        Returns:
        the resulting style declaration

      • hasPseudoDef

        public boolean hasPseudoDef(Element el,
                            cz.vutbr.web.css.Selector.PseudoDeclaration pseudo)
        Checks whether the element has some style defined for a specified pseudo-element.
        Parameters:
        el - The element to be checked
        pseudo - The pseudo element specification
        Returns:
        true if there is some style defined for the given pseudo-element

      • useStyle

        public void useStyle(Element el,
                     cz.vutbr.web.css.Selector.PseudoDeclaration pseudo,
                     cz.vutbr.web.css.NodeData style)
        Assigns the given style for the specified pseudo-element.
        Parameters:
        el - the element to be assigned the style
        pseudo - The pseudo-element or null if none is required
        style - the assigned style
